simsim.core
Class Spanner

java.lang.Object
  simsim.core.Spanner
All Implemented Interfaces:
Displayable
public class Spanner
extends java.lang.Object
implements Displayable

Creates a simplified graph covering all the nodes in the network. Can only be used with small sized systems, up to about 200 nodes.

Author:
SÃ©rgio Duarte (smd@di.fct.unl.pt)

Constructor Detail

Spanner

public Spanner()
Method Detail

setThreshold

public void setThreshold(double T)
Controls how the complete graph connecting all nodes will be simplified to create a cover graph (spanner)

Parameters:
T - - Is the maximum cost degradation allowed between any pair of nodes in the simplified graph, relative to the cost in the original complete graph. Any value larger than 1 is allowed, the greater the value, the sparser the resulting graph/tree is.

children

public java.util.Set<NetAddress> children(NetAddress root,
                                          NetAddress parent)
Given a node, chosen as the root node of a shortest paths tree, this method returns the children of that node. The shortest paths tree is computed as needed from the spanner graph produced by the current Threshold value, which can be changed using setThreshold().

Parameters:
root - - The root node of the shortest paths tree.
parent - - A node in the network.
Returns:
the children nodes of node selected as parent.

display

public void display(java.awt.Graphics2D gu,
                    java.awt.Graphics2D gs)
Description copied from interface: Displayable
Draws the implementing object in a simulator internal frame/window.

Specified by:
display in interface Displayable
Parameters:
gu - Unscaled graphics context of the internal frame/window.
gs - Scaled graphics context of the internal frame/window. Using this context, shapes are scaled according to a transformation applied to the frame/window.
